I haven't been able to reproduce these exceptions using N20040820 with ui.console from HEAD. 

With older versions of IOConsoleDocumentAdapter I have seen exceptions similar to the first one in the 
summary when the TextChangingEvent that it fired was incorrect. It would fire a TextChangingEvent 
that told the Text widget n lines would be added when fewer lines were really added. The widget would 
then ask for each line by calling getLine(int) and the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException would be 
thrown.

still investigating...

This is possibly caused by line delimiter differences between windows and Unix (which would explain 
why I can't reproduce). The document defines and String[] of legal line delimiters, but the 
IOConsoleDocumentAdapter was using the system property "line.separator" to calculate the number of 
lines being appended to the document and potentially underestimating the number of lines being 
appended.

Changed IOConsoleDocumentAdapter to use the String[] from the document instead of the system 
property.

Darin, do you still get the errors with the new code?

I no longer get the errors.

Verified.
